docs.text: but what if it became the new target ?

docs.text: this dark fantasy has unfortunately a very strong grounding in reality .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when a special branch of the united states military , under the command of general william devereaux ( bruce willis ) , takes prisoner suspected terrorist mastermind sheik ahmed bin talal , islamic fundamentalists across the world take notice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only warning the fbi receives is a single , cryptic message : " release him . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then all hell breaks loose in new york .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a bus is destroyed , killing 25 civilians .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a broadway theater is bombed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hostages are taken at a school .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the wave of terrorist activity crests , the president must consider if the only way to save the city and break the grip of fear is to declare martial law .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: devereaux argues against that eventuality , but is nevertheless ready to lead 10 , 000 men into action on american soil .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another person not in favor of martial law is anthony hubbard ( denzel washington ) , the fbi agent in charge of investigating the terrorist activities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his staff is comprised of smart , energetic , intelligent men and women very much unlike the usual group o !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: f moronic feds we're used to seeing in movies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hubbard develops an uneasy alliance with cia agent elise kraft ( annette bening ) , whose department knows more about the situation than they're willing to reveal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the attacks escalate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fbi are helpless , chasing an invisible enemy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the land is under siege .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they have lost control . . a
docs.label: positive

docs.text: terror is coming from within . .

docs.text: what's great about this film is that it is made as if holding up a mirror to life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it reflects reality .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and that's why it makes such an impact .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: edward zwick has created a clever , well written and terrifying thriller that may very well be one of the best films of the season .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the director manages to tell several stories simultaneously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and so his film plays on several levels , never loosing focus on its main objective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is exploring the abuse of power , the distrustful relationships that exist between various segments of the u . s . government ( the army , the fbi , and the cia ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he takes a look at the complexities inherent when so many secrets and lies are involved .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the palestinian community in 1998 new york is treated exactly as japanese americans were during world war ii .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are concentration camps and unlawful interments , all in the name of the " greater good . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the latter part of the film the land of opportunities looses its heart and soul -- freedom .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: was that what the terror !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ists really wanted ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film has evoked protests and objections from the arab-american population in the u . s . and n . y . especially .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but to me these protests seem unnecessary .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: zwick is careful to not step over the line and make the palestinians typical hollywood bad guys .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the script is therefore wonderfully balanced .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: agent hubbard's best friend and loyal colleague frank haddad ( tony shalhoub ) is lebanese-american .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and it is quite often you hear lines such as " my first boyfriend was palestinian .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they seduce you with their suffering " or " they love this country as much as we do . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but no matter how you twist this matter , you won't get away from the fact that when it comes to world wide terrorism it is arab-speaking population who are in the great majority .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: more to the point , the siege demonstrates the injustice of blanket condemnation of any ethnic group by depicting the unfair treatment of all arab-americans by the u . s . military .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and thus this film does not serve as a source for discrimination in any !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: denzel washington is dashing as always .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in this role he is much more determined and stronger than usual .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anette bening is enjoyable and believable as a shadowy cia operative who prefers espionage , a network of snitches and seduction to gather information . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bruce willis is terrifying as the sadist , hungry for power , that never looses his connection with the audience , since his point of view is not too hard to understand .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is elegantly shaped .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the scenes are easily floating into each other and the film never seems overlong .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: zwick knows exactly how to provoke tension , horror and emotions and does it with a rarely observed professionalism .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he tightens the intensity as the events progress .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and when a plot twist comes , it actually is surprising .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not a film drained in patriotism , like the work of roland emerich .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nor is it a film that portrays explosions purely for entertainment values .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a daring picture that has courage enough to undertake such a risky story and difficult journey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it has courage enough to get involved in politics .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it questions our foreign policies , mentality and defense .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i must admit that it ends rather disappointing , as the director turns the patriotism way up and innovation down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but despite of that , it is certainly an intelligent and thrilling film that provokes emotions and thoughts ; a virtue that few summer films can boast of .
docs.label: positive
